name: Caesar the Cat
description:
Players control Caesar the Cat, who must stop mice from eating food in the cupboard. This can be done by coming into contact with the mice so that Caesar has them in its mouth, and then carrying them to the larder door that appears on the side of the screen when you do so. There are three types of mice, and the amount of points you get for carrying them to the larder door depends on the type caught, with the highest scoring mouse rather difficult to catch. Players can hold down the fire button to increase Caesar's speed so that they can easily catch the mice, but they must also avoid knocking the jars off the cupboard.

A timer is present, and it counts down during the game. The time increases for each mouse the player successfully carried to the larder door, but decreases when the mice completely eats the food, when players knock jars down, or when they try to move past the game screen. The game ends when the timer reaches zero.

shot.caption: The game accepts keyboard or joystick as controls. The player can swap between joystick & keyboard in-game by pressing the K key
Caesar makes his appearance. The text appears as his tail moves across the screen
Caesar then watches while mice eat the words. This screen shows that different coloured mice score higher points
Caesar starts the game with 1000 points. points are gained for catching mice and are lost as food is eaten. Big points are lost if items are knocked from the shelves
When all Caesar's points have been lost the game is over. After a pause the player is returned to the first grey screen and the game restarts
Knocking this jar off ends the game immediately!
Caesar's caught a mouse, note the happy smile. Now he must exit the screen via the door in the top left to dispose of it
Caesar leaving the screen with mouse.
Taking the mouse through the door updates the hi-score value, resets the current countdown timer to 1000 points, and adds 1 to the 'mouse caught' counter
Caught mouse number 2 but jumping from this point knocks off the blue vase. This costs 1000 points and wipes out the current score ending the game
